snippet: Riddell, the country’s largest helmet manufacturer, will pay $3.1 million to a 22-year old man who was injured in 2008 while playing high school football.
abstract: Jury in Colorado finds that Riddell, country’s largest helmet manufacturer, is at fault for failure to adequately warn players wearing their football helmets about dangers of potential concussions; company is ordered to pay several million dollars in damages to 22-year-old man who was injured in 2008 while playing high school football.
lead_paragraph: Riddell, the country’s largest helmet manufacturer, will pay $3.1 million to a 22-year old man who was injured in 2008 while playing high school football.

headline.seo: Riddell Responsible for $3.1 Million in Damages to Former High School Football Player
